programme.title: Weightlifting | Olympic Qualifier | Day 8 | Grand Prix I | Havana
programme.desc: Watch the women's 81kg Group B and the men's 96kg and women's 76kg Group A Weightlifting competitions and join us for the Olympic Qualifier and IWF Grand Prix I in Havana, Cuba.

programme.title: See how this surf camp for children with autism transforms lives
programme.desc: Surfing star Parker Coffin visits Surfers Healing’s annual event in New Jersey and is blown away by how his sport can transform lives.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Surfer: How Does Brisa Hennessy Generate Power?
programme.desc: We took Costa Rican surfer Brisa Hennessy to a sports science lab to find out what makes the physique of a world class surfer. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Tokyo 2020 top scorer sets sights on World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Growing up in a rural town in Brazil, Richarlison took an unconventional path to success. He played for his hometown club until the age of 16. He embarked on a journey of many trials until he was signed by América Mineiro. His rise is nothing but remarkable with his move to Premier League club Tottenham. Tokyo 2020 was a dream tournament for him as he was given the fabled number 10 shirt and went on to win a Gold medal and the golden boot. Watch out for Richarlison who scored his country's first two goals at the 2022 World Cup.

programme.title: Iranian superstar ready to give all for national team | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Now one of Iran’s greatest ever footballers, Azmoun could have chosen volleyball but his father decided otherwise. He left Iran for Russia at the age of 18 to develop his talent and career. Unsuccessful striker at the 2018 World Cup, he made an impressive move to Bayer Leverkusen. Having now returned to the national team, he is ready to give it all for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

programme.title: World Cup winner from Argentinian football dynasty | World at their Feet
programme.desc: With a father, uncle and two older brothers all professionals, Alexis Mac Allister was destined for a life in football. All three brothers even achieved their dream of playing on the same team for Argentinos Juniors, which saw young Maradona starts his legendary career and played with their father in the late 70’s. As a very fine member of this Argentinian football dynasty, Mac Allister is aiming to weave his midfield magic at the World Cup.

programme.title: Japanese winger who qualified his team for the World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Having risen through the ranks at Kawasaki Frontale, Kaoru Mitoma made the unorthodox decision to go to University and not enter professional football. Now at Premier League Brighton, Mitoma’s greatest success so far has been for the national team so far. Scoring two vital goals to secure his nation's place at the World Cup. He is now ready to tackle the competition to come.

programme.title: The New-Zealand striker who made his dreams come true | World at their Feet
programme.desc: As one of only six kiwis to ever to play in Premier League, Chris Wood has achieved more than he could have ever imagined. Schooled by his football playing sister, Chris moved to England at the age of 15 and made his Premier League debut at 17. After a challenging period of loan moves, Wood met success with Millwall and a personal achievement at London 2012. Now a regular striker at Newcastle United, Wood’s New Zealand has just missed out on World Cup qualification. Arguably the nation’s greatest ever player, he has sights set on another great stage, Paris 2024 where he would be participating in the Olympics for the 3rd time.

programme.title: Shredding Monsters - Nazaré
programme.desc: Follow Garrett McNamara and a group of the world's best big wave surfers as they descend on Nazaré to catch the biggest swell of the year.

programme.title: Flag and Family 2
programme.desc: Profiles of what it means to be a first-generation athlete as they try to balance national and personal identities.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Rulon Gardner
programme.desc: From farmboy in Wyoming to taking down the unbeaten, unbeatable Russian for the Olympic gold! Rulon Gardner not only conquered Aleksandr Karelin, he has stared down death at least 3 times. Join Olympic Channel for a riveting, deeply emotional rewind with Rulon. Every minute of his Sydney 2000 Olympic gold and Athens 2004 Olympic bronze. The cheers and tears!

programme.title: The Oscar Figueroa story (extended version)
programme.desc: After a severe injury derailed his previous medal hopes, Figueroa put in all on the mat with one final attempt for gold in Rio 2016.

programme.title: Women's Singles QFs & Mix Doubles Bronze Medal - Badminton | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Musashino Forest Sport Plaza, Tokyo. It includes Women's Singles Quarterfinals and the Mixed Doubles Bronze Medal Match, in which WATANABE Yuta and HIGASHINO Arisa (JPN) beat TANG Chun Man & TSE Ying Suet (HKG) to take the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Court 1: Mens Doubles Bronze Medal, Mixed Doubles Semi-Final - Tennis | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Ariake Tennis Park, Tokyo. It includes the Men's Doubles Bronze Medal Match Krajikec/Sandgreen (USA) v Daniell/Venus (NZL) with Daniell/Venus (NZL) claiming the medal and the Mixed Doubles Semifinals Pavlyuchenkova/Rublev (ROC) v Barty/Peers (AUS) & Vesnina/Karatsev (ROC) v Stojanovic/Djokovic (SRB)

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Rulon Gardner
programme.desc: From farmboy in Wyoming to taking down the unbeaten, unbeatable Russian for the Olympic gold! Rulon Gardner not only conquered Aleksandr Karelin, he has stared down death at least 3 times. Join Olympic Channel for a riveting, deeply emotional rewind with Rulon. Every minute of his Sydney 2000 Olympic gold and Athens 2004 Olympic bronze. The cheers and tears!

programme.title: Table 1: Men's Singles Finals - Table Tennis | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Tokyo Metropolitan Gymnasium, Tokyo. It includes the Mens Singles Bronze Medal Match Min (TPE) v Ovtcharov (GER) with the later claiming Bronze and the men's Individual Gold Medal Match between Fan (CHN) and Ma (CHN) in which Ma claimed the Gold.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's +78kg, Men's +100kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals - Judo | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Nippon Budokan, Tokyo. Sone (JPN) claimed the Gold in the Women's +78kg and KRPALEK (CZE) in the Men's +100kg.

programme.title: Blue/Finals Piste: Men's Epee Bronze & Gold Medal Bouts - Fencing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Makuhari Messe Hall B, Chiba. It includes the Men's Epee Team Finals and the Victory Ceremony. JPN claimed the Gold, ROC Silver and KOR completed the podium.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Rulon Gardner
programme.desc: From farmboy in Wyoming to taking down the unbeaten, unbeatable Russian for the Olympic gold! Rulon Gardner not only conquered Aleksandr Karelin, he has stared down death at least 3 times. Join Olympic Channel for a riveting, deeply emotional rewind with Rulon. Every minute of his Sydney 2000 Olympic gold and Athens 2004 Olympic bronze. The cheers and tears!

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Ryan Millar
programme.desc: USA Volleyball star Ryan Millar describes the surreal atmosphere around his run to the Volleyball gold medal at the Olympic Summer Games Beijing 2008. How tragedy in the volleyball community inspired the team to rally behind its coach on this edition of “My Great Olympic Moments”.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Natalie Du Toit
programme.desc: South Africa’s Olympic legend Natalie Du Toit shares how an accident changed her life but did not dampen her dream of competing, and why swimming at the Olympics and Paralympics was more than winning gold. All this and more in “My Great Olympic Moments” with Natalie Du Toit.

programme.title: Fallbrook Braves Rugby Club
programme.desc: Scotland Rugby Sevens star Colin Gregor travels to California, USA to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling rugby team.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Natalie Du Toit
programme.desc: South Africa’s Olympic legend Natalie Du Toit shares how an accident changed her life but did not dampen her dream of competing, and why swimming at the Olympics and Paralympics was more than winning gold. All this and more in “My Great Olympic Moments” with Natalie Du Toit.

programme.title: GBR v AUS - Women's Quarter-Final - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 30/07/2021 at the Ibaraki Kashima Stadium, Kashima. Final Score GBR 3:4 AUS (AET).

programme.title: Women's Individual QFs/SFs/Finals - Archery | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at Yumenoshima Park Archery Field, Tokyo. An San (KOR) won Gold, Elena Osipova (ROC) took Silver and Lucilla Boari (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 6 - Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre,Tokyo. It includes the Men's 200m Backstroke, the Women's 100m Freestyle, Women's 200m Breaststroke, the Men's 200m Individual Medley Finals and their Victory Ceremonies as well as the Men's 100m Butterfly and Women's 200m Backstroke Semifinals. Schoenmaker (RSA) claimed Gold in the Women's 200m Breaststroke, Rylov (ROC) in the Men's 200m Backstroke, McKeon (AUS) in the Women's 100m Freestyle and Wang (CHN) in the Men's 200m Individual Medley.

programme.title: Eventing Dressage Team & Individual - Session 2 - Equestrian | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Equestrian Park, Tokyo.

programme.title: Men's Laser & 49er, Women's 49er FX - Sailing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 in and around the Enoshima Yacht Harbour, Fujisawa.

programme.desc: This match took place on 30/07/2021 at the Ibaraki Kashima Stadium, Kashima. Final Score GBR 3:4 AUS (AET).
